_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:29:20 using v2.0
title: How did NHS staff sickness rates vary by trust type?
analysis_commentary:
From January 2010 the national measure has been broken down by the trust type of the employee. All trust types show a similar pattern of sickness absence rates as the national figure, with peaks being observed in the late autumn/winter months.

Staff from ambulance trusts are more likely to be absent due to sickness as represented by a consistently higher average sickness absence rate over the time period. Acute trusts staff are less likely to be absent due to sickness as they are consistently lower than the national average sickness absence rate over the time period
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Sickness Absence Rates (Copyright Â© 2014, Health and Social Care Information Centre. All rights reserved)
